comments.html:
It's not here yet, but TCP-AO support in Linux is getting closer.

https://www.phoronix.com/news/TCP-AO-Linux-Kernel-Updated
comments.name: James Harr

comments.html:
Nice ;) Thanks for the pointer!

Now we have to wait for it to appear in Ubuntu (so we can run cEOS/FRR/Cumulus containers or Ubuntu VMs with TCP-AO) and to be supported by cEOS and FRR.

My bet would be on FRR being the first to get it implemented ;)
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
TCP-AO support has been merged into what is intended to become Linux 6.7 in a few months:

  • net-next merge
  • Linux TCP-AO documentation
comments.name: Erik Auerswald
